reference.title: Accessibility: Animations
reference.shortdesc: This describes techniques and implementation tips to meet IBM Web Accessibility for animations.

section.title: Advertising banners
section.p: For animated images, such as an advertising banner, equivalent alternative text must be assigned to each image, and it must include all important information that is conveyed by the image. Typically, unimportant information is considered to be aspects of the banner that do not convey information needed to understand the advertisement.

In some cases, the alternative text might be extremely lengthy and appear on several related web pages. As a result, it may be annoying to listen to the alternative text each time a related page opens. WAI guidelines recommend using less than 150 characters when dealing with alternative text. For cases in which a long description is needed, include a D-link in the advertising banner instead of alternative text.
